articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Command of KPA Navy
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Command of KPA Navy 
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, inspected the Command of the KPA Navy. 
					 Every serviceperson of the unit was filled with the determination to wipe out the enemy, should the confrontation maniacs dare start a war. The unit was ready to become human torpedoes and depth bombs to protect the honor of Juche Korea, Songun Korea and thus send all the enemy troops to the bottom of the sea and demonstrate the mettle of the army of Mt. Paektu which makes no empty talk and shows no mercy.
					
					 After receiving a salute, he looked up to the statue of President Kim Il Sung among soldiers and said with emotion that the undying feats performed by him in the building of revolutionary armed forces would shine forever in the history of the country. 
					
					 He went round the rooms devoted to the education in the revolutionary history and the history of the command. 
					
					 Seeing precious relics and mementoes, he looked back with deep emotion on the proud road of victory and glory covered by the unit.
					
					 The KPA Navy has fully displayed patriotic devotion and popular heroism in defending the country and socialist construction for the more than six decades and its command produced 103 heroes including heroes on Mujae Hill who protected the trees bearing revolutionary slogans, the eternal treasures of the WPK, at the cost of their lives, he noted, underscoring the need for the servicepersons of the navy to preserve this shining tradition and demonstrate the invincible might in the battles for devotedly defending the country in the future, too. 
					
					Looking round the operation study room, he learned in detail about the unit's performance of duty. 
					
					 He repeatedly praised the command for establishing the revolutionary training style of thinking of combat circumstances and putting their ideas into practice among commanding and staff officers of the unit and helping them widen their tactical insight. He, at the same time, praised them for firmly defending the seas of the country with the death-defying will to resolutely protect the party, revolution and socialist country by force of arms. 
					
					 As Korea is surrounded by seas on its three sides, the navy has very important role to play, he said, putting forth important tasks to serve as guidelines for bolstering up the armed force of the navy. 
					
					 Soldiers should always be combat-ready though there is no gunfire and keep themselves fully ready to win without fail in a do-or-die battle with the enemy, he said, adding that good fighters in war time are heroes and patriots, but those who are good at trainings are heroes and patriots in peacetime. 
					
					 He had a photo session with servicepersons of the Navy Command. 
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK; KPA Vice Marshal Ri Yong Ho, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and chief of the General Staff of the KPA; KPA General Kim Jong Gak, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and first vice-director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA; Kim Kyong Ok, member of the CMC of the WPK; and KPA Generals Kim Myong Guk, Kim Won Hong and Hyon Chol Hae.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Ri Jong San
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Ri Jong San
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, Sunday sent a wreath to the bier of Ri Jong San, alternate member of the C.C., the WPK, deputy to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly and vice marshal of the KPA, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Ri Jong San Dies
articles.content:
Ri Jong San Dies
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Ri Jong San, deputy to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, died of long illness at the age of 87 on July 23.
					 He participated in the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle commanded by President Kim Il Sung and bravely fought for achieving the liberation of the country with arms in his hand in the darkest period of the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 After the liberation of the country he grew up to be an able military officer under the care of Kim Il Sung. He worked hard to protect the Party and the leader with his life and develop the People's Army. He contributed to the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War by commanding servicepersons to wipe out enemies in the war period.
					
					 He devotedly worked to defend the security of the socialist country and gains of the revolution, holding responsible posts of the People's Army for years.
					
					 He was awarded the titles of Hero of the DPRK and Labor Hero, Order of Kim Il Sung and many other state commendations for his feats performed for the country and the revolution.
					
					 An obituary of Ri Jong San was jointly issued by the C.C., the WPK, the DPRK National Defence Commission and the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on July 23.

articles.title: U.S. Invites First Vice Foreign Minister of DPRK to New York
articles.content:
U.S.Invites First Vice Foreign Minister of DPRK to New York
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The United States invited Kim Kye Gwan, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, to New York to discuss the issue of resuming the six-party talks.
					 U.S. Department of State Secretary Hillary issued a statement in this regard on July 24.
					
					 Kim will meet with an interagency team of U.S. officials for discussions on the necessary steps, the statement said.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greetings to Maldivian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greetings to Maldivian President 
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a massage of greeting to Mohamed Nasheed, president of the Republic of Maldives, on July 23 on its independence day.
					 Kim in the message wished prosperity to Maldives, expressing belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would develop on good terms.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greetings to Liberian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greetings to Liberian President
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greeting to Ellen Johnson Sirleaf, president of Liberia, on its independence day.
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop in various fields.
					
					 He heartily wished the Liberian president big successes in the work to consolidate the national unity and achieve social and economic progress.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Cuban Ambassador
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Cuban Ambassador
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with outgoing Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK Jose Manuel Galego Montano at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.

articles.title: DPRK Order of Friendship 1st Class Awarded to Cuban Ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK Order of Friendship 1st Class Awarded to Cuban Ambassador
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Jose Manuel Galego Montano, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, was awarded DPRK Order of Friendship 1st Class.
					 This was in recognition of his positive support to the Korean people in their struggle to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and build a thriving socialist country and his distinguished contribution to boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries.
					
					 An awarding ceremony took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on July 25.
					
					 Present there were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, and officials concerned and staff members of the Cuban embassy here.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun FM Meets His Counterparts in Bali
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun FM Meets His Counterparts in Bali
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun, who is heading the DPRK delegation to the Ministerial Meeting of the ASEAN Regional Forum in Bali of Indonesia, on July 22 met and had talks separately with his Indonesian and Laotian counterparts Raden Mohammad Marty Muliana Natalegawa and Thongloun Sisoulith.
					 They are leading the delegations of their countries to the meeting.
					
					 Pak also met with Secretary-General of ASEAN Surin Pitsuwan.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets British Party Official
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets British Party Official
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a friendly talk with Glyn Ford, member of the National Policy Forum of the British Labor Party, and his companion on Monday when they paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Bulgaria Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Bulgaria Appointed
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Ju Wang Hwan was appointed as the DPRK ambassador to Bulgaria, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Floral Basket from Japanese Delegation
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Japanese Delegation
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The visiting delegation of the Japanese Women's Society for the Study of the Juche Idea presented a floral basket to leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Setsuko Kuwahata, member of the Japanese Society for the Study of Kimilsungism who is heading the delegation, handed it over to an official concerned on Monday.

articles.title: Election System Praised by Foreigners and Overseas Koreans
articles.content:
Election System Praised by Foreigners and Overseas Koreans
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests and overseas Koreans visited various polling stations in Pyongyang on July 24 when the election of deputies to provincial, city and county people's assemblies was underway.
					 They visited the polling stations of Sub-constituency No. 126 of Constituency No. 46, Sub-constituency No. 93 of Constituency No. 57 and Sub-constituency No. 88 of Constituency No. 87 and other polling stations in Pyongyang and were deeply moved to see the electors full of enthusiasm to consolidate the revolutionary power as firm as a rock.
					
					 Setsuko Kuwahata, head of the delegation of the Japanese Women's Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that she was admired to see the electors dancing and singing at the festively decorated polling stations.
					
					 Common workers are being chosen as deputies to power organs at various levels, she noted, adding this is a proof of the advantages of the election system in the DPRK.
					
					 Hiroshi Minamishima, professor at Joshibi University of Art and Design, said that every person faithful to the people has the right to be elected in the DPRK.
					
					 Wim van der Bijl from Netherlands noted his visit to the polling station helped him know better about the reality of the DPRK.
					
					 Glyn Ford, member of the National Policy Forum of the British Labor Party, said it was exciting to see the atmosphere at the polling station alive with pleasant dances.

articles.title: Events Held in DPRK to Celebrate War Victory Day
articles.content:
Events Held in DPRK to Celebrate War Victory Day
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Events took place in the DPRK on Monday to mark the 58th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The workers' art group of the C.C., General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea gave a celebration performance at the Central Hall of Workers while "July 27 will remain the eternal victory day under the guidance of our General", a concert of agricultural workers, was held at the Kumchon Revolutionary Site in Sunchon City, South Phyongan Province.
					
					 Their numbers included choruses "Long Live Generalissimo Kim Il Sung" and "Our Victory-Day July 27", male chorus "Song of National Defence", serial wartime songs "My Song in the Trench" and male trio and pangchang "For My Only Motherland".
					
					 The performers loudly sang of the feats of President Kim Il Sung who led the Fatherland Liberation War to the shining victory with his Juche-based military idea, distinguished strategy and prominent commanding art.
					
					 They also represented well the mental world and heroic struggle of the Korean army and people who won the shining victory in the war by defeating the aggressors, closely rallied around the President.
					
					 On the same day a meeting between heroes and women's union members took place at the Women's Hall in Pyongyang.

articles.title: People Visit Jonsung Museum on War Victory Day
articles.content:
People Visit Jonsung Museum on War Victory Day
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- An endless stream of visitors is flowing to the Jonsung Revolutionary Museum with the war victory day as an occasion.
					 Among them are servicepersons of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, officials of ministries and national institutions, working people and school youth and children. 
					
					 The museum has been visited by 2.24 million people from at least 13 000 units so far in the new century. 
					
					 On display there are relics and data showing the immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung who led the anti-U.S. war to victory with his Juche-oriented military idea and distinguished commanding art during the last Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 The visitors have keenly realized that thanks to his leadership the Korean army and people could inflict a serious defeat on the aggressors in military, political and moral aspects in the sacred war against the U.S. and fully display the dignity of the country and the nation to the whole world. 
					
					 A large number of overseas compatriots and foreigners, too, visited the museum. They expressed boundless reverence for the President, praising him as the peerlessly legendary and brilliant commander who registered a shining chapter in the history of struggle against imperialism and the U.S.

articles.title: Military Attaches Tour Historic Site Associated with Fatherland Liberation War
articles.content:
Military Attaches Tour Historic Site Associated with Fatherland Liberation War
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps in the DPRK visited the historic site associated with the Fatherland Liberation War on Monday to mark the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the war.
					 The visitors toured the commanding post of the Supreme Headquarters, the operation room, etc. at the site, being briefed on the fact that President Kim Il Sung led the whole party and army and all the people to victory in the war with his original military idea, strategy and tactics and distinguished commanding art while staying there during the war.
					
					 They also went round various historic relics associated with the activities of leader Kim Jong Il, who grasped the Juche-oriented military tactics of the President and fostered his lofty patriotic idea in this place during the war.
					
					 At the end of the visit they made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Secondary School in DPRK Renamed after Martyr Luo Shengjiao
articles.content:
Secondary School in DPRK Renamed after Martyr Luo Shengjiao 
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of renaming Sakchang Secondary School in Songchon County, South Phyongan Province, after Luo Shengjiao, martyr of the Chinese People's Volunteers, took place on Monday. 
					 Luo saved a drowning Korean boy at the cost of his life at the age of 21 after rushing to the Korean front for fight under the banner of resisting America and aiding Korea, safeguarding the home and defending the motherland during the last Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 A decree of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on renaming the school after Luo Shengjiao was read out and the signboard of the school "Luo Shengjiao Secondary School" was put up. 
					
					 Then followed speeches. 
					
					 Ri Man Ho, chairman of the Songchon County People's Committee, said the renaming of the school after Luo at a time when the 50th anniversary of the conclusion of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance was marked reflected the noble intention of leader Kim Jong Il to hand over the baton of the DPRK-China friendship to the generations to come. 
					
					 The DPRK would further consolidate the DPRK-China friendship together with the Chinese comrades in the spirit of the agreement reached by the top leaders of the two countries, he said.
					
					 Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Hongcai said martyr Luo Shengjiao recorded a beautiful chapter in the history of the Sino-DPRK friendship by displaying the internationalist spirit.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung wrote his autograph in high praise of the feats of the martyr, he noted.
					
					 The promulgation of the decree on renaming the school after Luo Shengjiao shows the feelings of friendship of the Party, government and people of the DPRK toward the party, government and people of China, he stressed.
					
					 Prior to the ceremony, the participants laid bouquets before the grave of Luo before observing a moment's silence. 
					
					 Meanwhile, an agreement on establishing the friendly ties between Luo Shengjiao Secondary School and the primary school under the College of Education of Jishou University in Hunan Province, China was signed on July 15.

articles.title: Songdowon International Children's Camp Opens
articles.content:
Songdowon International Children's Camp Opens
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A ceremony took place on Monday to receive the 26th batch of Songdowon international children's campers. 
					 Present at the ceremony were Kil Chol Hyok, secretary of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, officials concerned and camping groups from China, Russia, Tanzania and the DPRK. 
					
					 They laid floral baskets and flowers before the statue of President Kim Il Sung at the camp to pay tribute to him. 
					
					 They heard a congratulatory address and a report and speeches. 
					
					 The campers will spend pleasant and joyful days while conducting various activities such as maritime sports and amusement games and mark national days.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Terms Ulji Freedom Guardian Dangerous
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Terms Ulji Freedom Guardian Dangerous 
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the south Korean authorities announced that south Korea would stage together with the U.S. the joint military exercises Ulji Freedom Guardian from August 16 to 26.
					 Involved in these war exercises will be more than 30,000 U.S. troops including at least 3,000 from overseas bases and 56 000 troops of the puppet army of south Korea and other huge armed forces of aggression and war hardware.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 The announcement of the plan for this saber-rattling is an open military threat to the DPRK and a blatant challenge to the peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 They informed the DPRK of the plan, claiming they are "command post" exercises and aimed at "coping with threat". But this is nothing but a cunning artifice to cover up the provocative and aggressive nature of the saber-rattling.
					
					 It is the plan of the puppet warmongers to stage the drill of "stabilizing the north and an operation for transfer to civilian administration" to cope with "contingency" while conducting the above-said maneuvers this year. They are contemplating letting the "agency for five provinces of the north" and the "committee for five provinces of the north", bodies for "unification of systems," take part in the drill for the first time. This fact suffices to clearly show the sinister goal and aggressive nature of the projected joint military exercises. It is preposterous, indeed, for them to claim this saber-rattling is aimed to cope with the "threat" from someone.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Anniversary of Democratic Front for Reunification of Korea Marked
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Anniversary of Democratic Front for Reunification of Korea Marked
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday dedicates an article to the 65th anniversary of the formation of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea (July 22, 1946.)
					 The article says:
					
					 The DFRK is an organization of the reunification front reflecting the common desire of the fellow countrymen to establish the sovereignty of the nation throughout Korea and achieve the reunification of the country and prosperity of the nation. 
					
					 The formation of the DFRK marked a historic event of weighty importance in the struggle of the Korean people for national reunification as it was the brilliant fruition of the idea of great national unity and the line of reunification front set forth and consistently maintained by President Kim Il Sung during the period of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle. 
					
					 With this formation as a momentum, all the democratic political parties, social organizations and people of all strata who love the country and nation and desire reunification of the country came to unite as one under the banner of the great national unity irrespective of ideology, ism, political view and religious belief and waged a more dynamic struggle for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country. 
					
					 The DFRK has made a glorious and shining history through its struggle for national unity and reunification since the very day of its formation and developed to be a solid and mass organization of the united front. 
					
					  The President put forward the idea that the great national unity directly means the reunification of the country and set the great national unity as a main task of the movement for national reunification. 
					
					 General secretary Kim Jong Il formulated the three principles of national reunification, the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo and the 10-point program of the great unity of the whole nation as three mainstays and three charters for national reunification, clearly indicating targets and orientation for the Korean people to achieve the cause of reunification. 
					
					 He provided the historic inter-Korean summits and the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration whose main idea is "By Korean nation itself". This is the special exploit he has performed for the great national unity and achieving the cause of national reunification, the article concludes.

articles.title: Korean People's War Victory Viewed as Miracle
articles.content:
Korean People's War Victory Viewed as Miracle
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Korean people are celebrating the anniversary of their great victory in the Fatherland Liberation War, July 27.
					 The Korean army and people owe the victory to the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung, an invincible and iron-willed commander.
					
					 When they started the war, the U.S. imperialists were definitely sure of their victory, saying that the result of the war was already decided.
					
					 But they, overpowered by the President's superb strategies and distinguished commanding art, surrendered Seoul three days after the outbreak of the war, and failed to hold the defense line along the River Kum, which they had advertised as "last defense line" and "line of no retreat". They even lost battles in Taejon. 
					
					 During the war their "general Christmas offensive", "summer and autumn offensives" and "model battle" ended in laughingstocks of the world people.  
					
					 At that time a U.S. newspaper said it was hard for the U.S. to vouch for its victory in the war.
					
					 Progressive people all over the world highly praised the DPRK for having defeated the U.S. imperialists styling themselves the strongest in the world, only five years after freeing itself from the imperialist yoke.   
					
					 They also viewed the victory as a genuine miracle wrought by the President's outstanding military strategies and ideas.

articles.title: Land Management Makes Headway in DPRK
articles.content:
Land Management Makes Headway in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The DPRK made a good result in tree-planting, river improvement, road construction and town and village facelifting throughout the country during the nationwide spring campaign for land management from March to May.
					 Pyongyang people created many green belts and flowerbeds covering tens of thousands of square meters and planted millions of flowering plants.
					
					 People of South Phyongan Province planted tens of thousands of trees of good species along major roads and railways and trees for props in hundreds of hectares. Phyongsong, the seat of the province, built a park and created green belts and flowerbeds along streets. 
					
					 North Hwanghae Province finished the construction of a road linking three power stations built along the River Ryesong. Yonthan County planted trees of economic value in nearly 700 hectares.
					
					 Jagang Province concentrated effort on improving many roads, while South Hwanghae Province built a nature-driven waterway extending some 70 kilometers.
					
					 The plans for planting Evodia daniellii and trees for paper manufacture were carried out at 112 and 110 percent respectively throughout the country during the months.

articles.title: Housing Construction Progresses Apace in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Housing Construction Progresses Apace in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The housing construction project in the Mansudae area in the centre of Pyongyang is moving ahead quickly.
					 Builders belonging to the General Bureau of Capital Construction are taking the lead in the project.
					
					 They are undertaking the construction of a 25-storied apartment building. They finished the ground-making in one month and erected thirteen stories as of July 24.
					
					 They are operating mixer cars, heavy-duty lorries, skips and other machines and equipment at full capacity.
					
					 New construction methods and technical inventions have been introduced in the project.
					
					 The method of sliding by jack takes only two and half days to build one story.

articles.title: Bulgarian President Hopes for Steady Good Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Bulgarian President Hopes for Steady Good Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Bulgaria attaches importance to the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation with the DPRK and hopes that these relations would continue to develop on good terms in all fields.
					 Georgi Parvanov, president of Bulgaria, said this on July 20 when meeting outgoing DPRK Ambassador to his country Jo Sung Ju.
					
					 We are rejoiced over the fact that the relations between the two countries are favorably developing in different domains including politics, culture, education and public health, the president said, adding:
					
					 We hope that the issue of the Korean Peninsula would be settled in a peaceful way in conformity with the interests of the Korean people and they would register greater success in the drive to build a thriving nation.

articles.title: Measures Urged to Clean Irradiated Korean School in Japan
articles.content:
Measures Urged to Clean Irradiated Korean School in Japan
 Tokyo, July 24 (KNS-KCNA) -- Korean Primary and Secondary School in Fukushima, Japan, urged the prefecture administration to pay for cleaning the school campus contaminated by radioactivity.
					 Representatives of the school education society and students' parents called at the office of the prefecture on July 8 to submit a letter containing their demand to the governor.
					
					 The letter explained the actual situation of the school polluted by radioactivity leaked from the Fukushima Atomic Power Plant.
					
					 Students of the school, severely damaged by the earthquake and tidal flood, are now studying at Niigata Primary and Secondary School, while their parents are restoring the damaged and irradiated school, the letter said.
					
					 The letter urged the prefecture administration to take equal measures for the Korean school with Japanese schools in eliminating radioactive contamination.

articles.title: Korean People's Cause of National Reunification Supported in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Korean People's Cause of National Reunification Supported in Bangladesh
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Khaleq Zaman Bhuiyan, general secretary of the C.C., Socialist Party of Bangladesh, on July 20 issued a statement on the 14th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification."
					 The statement said:
					
					 In the work Kim Jong Il gave a comprehensive and scientific exposition of the issues arising in putting an end to the national division and reunifying the country.
					
					 He formulated the three principles of national reunification, the ten-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo, advanced by President Kim Il Sung, as the three charters for Korea's reunification.
					
					 The desire of all Koreans for reunification will be achieved when they thoroughly preserve and implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, embodiment of the three charters of national reunification.
					
					 We extend full support and solidarity to the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people in their just struggle to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: S. Korean Defense Ministry Plans to Import Weapons
articles.content:
S. Korean Defense Ministry Plans to Import Weapons
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Ministry of Defense on July 20 decided to import large attack helicopters and new type fighter planes.
					 This decision was made at a meeting of the committee for promotion of defense work with a view to providing armed support to five islands in the West Sea of Korea, sensitive waters between the north and the south, and taking the initiative in possible war.

articles.title: S. Korea: Authorities' Suppression Assailed
articles.content:
S. Korea: Authorities' Suppression Assailed
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Students and citizens of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on July 20 in protest against the "government" authorities' reckless repression. They are now under the authorities' persecution for the mere reason that they participated in the candlelight rally for settlement of the registration fee issue.
					 In the press conference speakers accused the police of issuing summons to at least 200 students and inhabitants involved in the candlelight rally to appear at the police station.
					
					 Such deed intended to control rallies and demonstrations is evidently a violation of the people's basic rights, they said.
					
					 At the end of the conference they went to the Police Agency in group in token of their protest.
					
					 When the police checked them from going to the agency, they declared that they would strongly counter the suppression of the candlelight actions, rejecting the authorities' investigation.
					
					 Meanwhile, the south Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century said on July 22 that it would continue the candlelight rally for settlement of the registration fee issue at Chonggye Square in Seoul.

articles.title: Punishment of Intelligence Service Chief Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Punishment of Intelligence Service Chief Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification on July 21 issued a statement titled "Won Se Hun, director of the Intelligence Service keen on suppression and violation of democracy, step down at once".
					 On July 20 the judicial authorities issued warrants of arrest, additionally applied by the IS for four persons concerned of the reunification movement. Thus five of 12 persons who had been subject to search from July 4 to 6 have been detained on charges of the violation of the notorious "National Security Law".
					
					 Recalling this fact, the statement said the current repressive case is nonsensical and outrageous ranging from its fabrication to search and confiscation, arrest and punishment.
					
					 Won Se Hun, director of the IS, is to blame for this rude outrage, the statement pointed out.
					
					 As soon as he became chief of the IS, all sorts of suppressive rackets were kicked off and there happened such unprecedented case as politically-motivated murder of the former "president", it noted.
					
					 The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification will wage a dynamic struggle to punish such traitors as Won Se Hun seeking to maintain at any cost the anti-DPRK confrontation policy of the Lee Myung Bak dictatorial regime finding itself in a crisis, the statement said.

articles.title: S. Korean Soldier Commits Suicide
articles.content:
S. Korean Soldier Commits Suicide
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A soldier of a military unit in Cholwon of south Korean Kangwon Province committed suicide by exploding a hand grenade on July 22, south Korean KBS reported.
					 Recently in south Korea such suicidal cases have been reported in the army in succession. Those soldiers committed suicide, cursing the society, unable to bear inhuman maltreatment by the senior.

articles.title: Electricity-saving Campaign in Cuba
articles.content:
Electricity-saving Campaign in Cuba
 Havana, July 24 (KCNA) -- Cuba is directing efforts to economizing in electricity.
					 The country reduced electricity consumption in the first quarter of the year to save 30,700 tons of oil.
					
					 This was attributable to the systematic control of electricity consumption index at public organs.

articles.title: Iran Inaugurates Solar Power Plant
articles.content:
Iran Inaugurates Solar Power Plant 
 Tehran, July 24 (KCNA) -- Iran inaugurated its biggest solar power plant in Mashhad City, Khorasan Province on Thursday.
					 Its yearly capacity of electricity production is 72,000 kwh.

articles.title: Peru's President Rejects U.S. Blockade of Cuba
articles.content:
Peru's President Rejects U.S. Blockade of Cuba
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Peruvian President Ollanta Humala voiced his disagreement with the almost 50-year U.S. economic, commercial and financial blockade of Cuba. He said this in a speech during his visit to Cuba on July 19.
					The blockade has inflicted unspeakable pain to the Cuban people and lots of economic losses to Cuba, he noted.
					
					 "It is shameful that this type of situation exists in the 21st century," 
					
					Humala said, demanding the U.S. administration repeal at once the anti-Cuba blockade step.

articles.title: PNA Warns of New Measures to Oppose Israeli Policy on Palestinian Prisoners
articles.content:
PNA Warns of New Measures to Oppose Israeli Policy on Palestinian Prisoners
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The minister of Prisoners Affairs of the Palestinian National Authority on July 21 accused Israel of taking wrong steps against Palestinian prisoners.
					 Recently the Israeli judicial authorities decided to take steps encroaching upon the rights of the Palestinian prisoners. The PNA would take strong measures against them, he said.
					
					 The Israeli judiciary "is a tool to provide legal covering to the acts that violate humanitarian and international laws," he said.

articles.title: Cooperation of Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation of Different Countries
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Kazakhstan and Russia launched a joint emergency drill Thursday.
					 The government of Mozambique has promised to improve the supply of power to Botswana on the same day.
					
					 On July 19 Cuba and Peru agreed to boost cooperative relations in various fields.

articles.title: Heroin Seized in Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Heroin Seized in Uzbekistan
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Uzbek secret agents seized 18 kilograms of heroin on an international train Tuesday.
					 Last year Uzbek authorities seized a total of 4,716.6 kg of illegal drugs and captured 115 foreign drug dealers, a news report said.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Solomon Islands
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Solomon Islands 
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A 6.2-magnitude earthquake hit waters off Solomon Islands on July 21.
					 The epicenter was about 260 km east from Honiara.

articles.title: Japanese Organizations Protest U.S. Nuclear Tests
articles.content:
Japanese Organizations Protest U.S. Nuclear Tests
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Atomic bomb survivors' groups in Hiroshima and Nagasaki in southwestern Japan on Wednesday lodged protests against the United States for conducting sub-critical nuclear tests last December and this February.
					 They suspected that the United States' "real intent is to retain its position as a nuclear power," given the repeated sub-critical nuclear and other experiments to test new nuclear technology.
					
					 They urged the Japanese government to protest the tests strongly.

articles.title: U.S. Jobless Claims Up
articles.content:
U.S. Jobless Claims Up 
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The number of Americans initially applying for unemployment aid rose in the U.S. due to economic depression.
					 The U.S. Labor Department Thursday said the advance figure for seasonally adjusted initial claims for jobless benefits in the week ending July 16 was 418,000, an increase of 10,000 from the prior week's revised figure.

articles.title: Financial Difficulties Get Serious at Businesses of Japan, France
articles.content:
Financial Difficulties Get Serious at Businesses of Japan, France
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Japan's crude steel production in June declined 5.0 percent from a year earlier, the Japan Iron and Steel Federation quoted survey data on July 20. This was attributable to the serious economic depression.
					 Quarterly sales of Alstom, France's main company in transport infrastructure and power generation, dropped by 12 percent on dim performance of thermal power and transport activities over the April-June period.

articles.title: Europeans Pessimistic about Economic Situation
articles.content:
Europeans Pessimistic about Economic Situation
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Europeans are getting pessimistic about the economic situation, worrying over its depression.
					 The European Union Commission said in a preliminary estimate on Wednesday that the indicator for consumer confidence in the 17-nation eurozone fell from minus 9.7 in May to minus 11.42 in June.

articles.title: Canada Damaged by Forest Fires
articles.content:
Canada Damaged by Forest Fires
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Forest fires recently broke out in succession in Northern Ontario Province, Canada, causing damage.
					 112 wildfires occurred as of July 21. As a result, nearly 750,000 acres were burnt and 3,330 people airlifted to safety and airliner service canceled.

articles.title: Development in Minority Regions of China
articles.content:
Development in Minority Regions of China
 Beijing, July 24 (KCNA) -- China has always directed deep concern for the development of the minority regions. 
					 Many successes have been made in those regions thanks to the concern and steps taken by the party and state and creative labor drive of the people in the regions.
					
					 They have achieved political stability and unity and rapid progress in economy.
					
					 In the period of the 11th Five-Year Plan, their economic growth surpassed the nationwide average annual growth.
					
					 Total output value in the Tibet autonomous region grew 12.3 percent in 2010 as compared with that in the previous year and that in the Xinjiang Uygur autonomous region jumped 10.6 percent. 
					
					 Infrastructural construction made brisk headway, significantly improving the transport conditions.
					
					 The total length of roads in the regions totaled 880 000 km as of the end of 2009 and motor roads have found their ways to 98 percent of the rural areas.
					
					 Great progress has been made in education, culture and public health.
					
					 70 457 schools at all levels are now operating in the above-said regions and nine-year compulsory education is enforced there in the main.
					
					 There appeared independent scientific institutions and scientific and technological dissemination centres to widely introduce advanced scientific and technological achievements into production.
					
					 The number of the units for preserving major cultural relics increased to 366 and inhabitants' radio audience rate to 85 percent and that of TV audience reached 90 percent by 2010.
					
					 The number of hospitals and their beds and medical workers has doubled since 1978.
					
					 The average life span of the inhabitants in the Tibet autonomous region rose to 67 years from 35.5 years in 1959.

articles.title: China Rejects Japanese Judicial Panel's Decision to Indict Chinese Captain
articles.content:
China Rejects Japanese Judicial Panel's Decision to Indict Chinese Captain
 Beijing, July 24 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Chinese Foreign Ministry at a press conference on July 22 accused Japan of its unilateral action.
					 The Naha District Public Prosecutors Office, Okinawa Prefecture, Japan decided to indict a Chinese captain involved in a collision with two Japanese patrol boats in the East China Sea last September. The spokesman labeled it unlawful and invalid.

articles.title: Chinese Paper Rejects West's Accusations
articles.content:
Chinese Paper Rejects West's Accusations
 Beijing, July 24 (KCNA) -- Beijing Daily on July 22 carried an article rejecting the West's accusations against China.
					 Recently China protested against the U.S. chief executive's meeting with the Dalai Lama. In this regard some media of the West let loose a string of speculations and outbursts only to reveal hostile mentality towards China, the daily said.
					
					 It is not the first time that Western media released such misinformation falsifying facts and making profound confusion of the right and wrong and applied a double-standard in interpreting China's opposition to separatist acts, it noted.
					
					 If one relies on the West, one is considered as a liberal force, a protector of human rights and the one to be supported by it, but if any party is opposed to it, the party is libeled a dictatorial rule, a wicked force and a terrorist organization and the target of its attack. This is an absurd logic of the Western countries and among them the U.S. does the worst thing, it added.
					
					 The Chinese can never accept such logic of the West, it stressed.

articles.title: Chinese Vice-President Calls for Ensuring Tibet Stability
articles.content:
Chinese Vice-President Calls for Ensuring Tibet Stability
 Beijing, July 24 (KCNA) -- Chinese Vice President Xi Jinping on July 19 called for ensuring the stability of Tibet.
					 At a meeting with senior military, police and judicial officials in Tibet, he said the work of the region is of strategic importance in all the party and state affairs and its security and stability are related to those of the state.
					
					 He also called on soldiers to fully discharge their noble mission in reunifying the country, ensuring the security of the state and defending the stability of Tibet.

articles.title: China's Effort to Save Energy, Reduce Emissions
articles.content:
China's Effort to Save Energy, Reduce Emissions  
 Beijing, July 24 (KCNA) -- A State Council meeting was held in China on July 19 as regards energy saving and emission reduction.
					 The meeting discussed a working plan to save energy and reduce emissions, a plan to introduce the energy-saving goals and a program for controlling pollution during the nation's 12th Five-Year Plan period.

articles.title: Colombia Celebrates 201st Independence Day
articles.content:
Colombia Celebrates 201st Independence Day
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Colombia celebrated its 201st Independence Day Wednesday.
					 A celebration took place in Bogota.
					
					 Colombian President Juan Manuel Santos attended there and delivered a speech. Then followed a military parade.
					
					 Colorful events took place in local cities.

articles.title: Fumigation, One of Koryo Therapies
articles.content:
Fumigation, One of Koryo Therapies
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Koryo medical experience and therapies have been put on a scientific basis in the DPRK to prove more efficacious in medical treatment.
					 One of the therapies is fumigation.
					
					 The method is to treat diseases with steam generating and fumes rising from herbs when they are boiled or burnt.
					
					 According to famous medical books Uibangryuchwi, Hyangyakjipsongbang and Tonguibogam, fumigation began to be used for medical treatment in the country hundreds of years ago.
					
					 Steam or fumes are applied all over the body or to ailing parts. 
					
					The effective therapy gives no side effect and has a wide variety of application.
					
					 It is also easy to apply as it does not need any special apparatuses, but a small amount of medicinal materials.
					
					 The combination of the method with other therapies is also available for medical care.
					
					 The Academy of Koryo Medicine and South Phyongan Provincial Koryo Hospital have applied fumigation to neuralgia and other diseases.

articles.title: Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum
articles.content:
Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Many people, including schoolchildren, have visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum in Pyongyang with the approach of the war victory day (July 27).
					 The visitors total 3,000 on the average every day.
					
					 Since the museum was opened in August 17, Juche 42 (1953), it has been visited by some 31 million people, including hundreds of thousands of overseas Koreans and foreigners.
					
					 The museum houses historic relics and materials showing President Kim Il Sung's activities and feats in the period ranging from the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle to the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Displayed in the museum are sand tables, models and panoramic and semi-panoramic pictures, as well as weapons and other combat equipment.
					
					 The museum provides the visitors with a good knowledge of the President's distinguished military wisdom, Juche-based military ideas, superb commanding art and noble traits.

articles.title: CPC Central Committee Arranges Round-table Talks with Personages outside Party
articles.content:
CPC Central Committee Arranges Round-table Talks with Personages outside Party
 Beijing, July 24 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Communist Party of China held round-table talks with personages outside the CPC in Zhongnanhai on July 21 at which views were exchanged with them over economic affairs.
					 Hu Jintao, general secretary of the CPC Central Committee, at the round-table talks referred to the achievements made in economic development in the first half of the year. He called upon the above-said personages to effectively work with the firm faith and make positive efforts to bring about a good phase in the economic and social development during the 12th Five-Year Plan.
					
					 He stressed the need for all democratic party groupings, the Chinese National Federation of Industry and Commerce and independent personages to make dynamic survey and study and devote their efforts and wisdom to accomplishing the goals and duties for economic and social development this year.

articles.title: Israeli-made Weapons Are Used for Disturbance in Pakistan: Interior Minister
articles.content:
Israeli-made Weapons Are Used for Disturbance in Pakistan: Interior Minister
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- Israeli-made weapons have been used to cause disturbance in Pakistan, said the Pakistani interior minister recently.
					 The minister told a press conference that Israeli-made weapons were seized from some 200 rebels arrested some time ago. 
					
					 The fact proves disturbance is backed by outside forces, he said. Now an investigation is going on to discover who are supporting the rebels and supplying them with weapons.

articles.title: Bomb Explosion, Shooting Incident in Norway
articles.content:
Bomb Explosion, Shooting Incident in Norway 
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- A bomb explosion and shooting incident were reported from Oslo, Norway, on July 22.  
					 Two hours after a bomb was exploded in downtown Oslo where the government building is located, a gunman shot at people on the suburbs of Oslo.
					
					 As of Saturday, 87 people were confirmed dead and scores of others injured. The government building and nearby buildings were severely damaged.
					
					 An investigation of the incidents is under way.

articles.title: U.S. Urged to Respect China's Core Interests
articles.content:
U.S. Urged to Respect China's Core Interests
 Beijing, July 24 (KCNA) -- Zhou Wenzhong, vice-chairman of China-U.S. Friendship Association, urged the U.S. to respect the core interests of China at a press conference on July 19.
					 Responding to a question concerning the Chinese protest against the U.S. president's recent meeting with the Dalai Lama, the ex-ambassador to the U.S. said the Chinese position on this issue is consistent and clear.
					
					 The U.S. should properly deal with issues of bilateral relations to prevent recurrence of such a thing, he added.

articles.title: U.S. Sinister Scheme behind "Underground Internet" Disclosed
articles.content:
U.S. Sinister Scheme behind "Underground Internet" Disclosed 
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The U.S. government is secretly running "underground internet" in a sinister attempt to incite hostilities in other countries.
					 In this regard the DPRK's major newspaper Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a bylined article:
					
					 This internet serves to provide information to rebels in those countries standing for independence against imperialism. 
					
					 It, called "stealth internet", can be used in any place and the U.S. has already invested 2 million dollars on its operation. 
					
					 The U.S. intends to massively spread the American-style view on value, bourgeois idea and culture and false data through internet and thus create social chaos and political instability in those anti-imperialist and independent countries and infuse the reactionary and rotten American idea and culture and way of life into their peoples. 
					
					 The U.S. is now putting under its control 13 internet servers to spread impure propaganda articles all over the world. 
					
					 It pushes ahead the development of technical means able to launch destructive cyber attack on national networks in other countries while trying to use cyber warfare as pretext for military invasion of those countries going against its grit.
					
					 It is has been proven by the fact that the U.S. Department of Defense some time ago warned it would counter "cyber attack" from someone with armed forces.

articles.title: U.S. Should Change Policy towards DPRK
articles.content:
U.S. Should Change Policy towards DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Strategy Institute under U.S. Army College announced a report on July 19 calling for switchover in the U.S. administration's policy towards the DPRK.
					 The report said there is chance for the U.S. administration to repair its policy towards the DPRK, adding that it would be hard to expect progress in implementing this policy unless the U.S. comes out for dialogue with the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. should reach a level of establishing diplomatic ties with the DPRK at last through phases of dialogue, negotiation and cultural exchange, it said.
					
					 The use of force and rupture of dialogue would bring adverse effect, the report said, urging the U.S. to provide a new treaty replacing the Armistice Agreement with the DPRK and ensure security to the DPRK.

articles.title: Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (22)
articles.content:
Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (22)
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- This is a story about the Ponbu Kindergarten in the city of Sinuiju well known for having trained a large number of prodigies.
					 It was in January 2006 that leader Kim Jong Il met six-year-old Ku Tae Hong and Kim Hyok Il, prodigies of the kindergarten, on the way of his field guidance.
					
					 Seeing calligraphic works and paintings produced by these children, the leader highly appreciated their distinguished talents. He learned about their hope and education for them and said that they should be effectively trained to become excellent talents. He gave them calligraphic and painting tools as gifts.
					
					 Under his loving care the children gave full play to their ability, displaying their distinguished skills at several national calligraphic and pencil drawing festivals.
					
					 In March and April this year he saw letters and collections of works presented by Ku Tae Hong and Kim Hyok Il, who are studying at the secondary course of Sinuiju College of Arts, and showed warm benevolence again for them.
					
					 The garden of talents in the DPRK is coming into fuller bloom under the warm sunshine.

articles.title: Work Printed in Bangladeshi Paper
articles.content:
Work Printed in Bangladeshi Paper
 Pyongyang, July 25 (KCNA) -- The Bangladeshi paper Natun Bangla on July 19 carried the full text of general secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification."
					 The work, published on August 4, 1997, expounds the undying feats President  Kim Il Sung performed in the cause of national reunification.
					
					 It also formulates as the three charters for national reunification the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic 
					
					Federal Republic of Koryo, advanced by the President, and indicates the tasks and ways for realizing the cause of national reunification based on them.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il inspecciona comandancia de fuerzas navales del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il inspecciona comandancia de fuerzas navales del EPC
 Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, inspecciono la comandancia de las fuerzas navales del EPC. 
					 Le acogieron en el mismo lugar el general de ejercito del EPC, Jong Myong Do, miembro de la Comision Militar Central del PTC y comandante en jefe de las fuerzas navales del EPC, y el coronel general del EPC, O Chol San, y otros miembros de la comandancia. 
					
					 Tras recibir el parte de recepcion, el Comandante Supremo vio la estatua de bronce del Presidente  Kim Il Sung entre los soldados recordando que las imborrables proezas de el realizadas en la construccion de las fuerzas armadas revolucionarias seran eternas en los anales de la patria. 
					
					 El Comandante Supremo recorrio la sala de educacion en la historia revolucionaria y la sala del historial. 
					
					 Pasando revista a los objetos y datos historicos, recordo con emocion la orgullosa trayectoria de la unidad llena de victorias y glorias. 
					
					 Durante largo tiempo de mas de 60 anos, las fuerzas navales del EPC han manifestado sin reservas la abnegacion patriotica y el heroismo masivo en la defensa de la patria y en la construccion socialista, senalo. 
					
					 En ese curso salieron de esta unidad 103 heroes incluso a los soldados del pico Mujae quienes defendieron con vida las consignas revolucionarias inscritas en arboles, riquezas de eterna duracion de nuestro partido, destaco y agrego que los oficiales y soldados de la unidad deben mantener esta tradicion orgullosa y exaltar en el futuro tambien el poderio invencible en la batalla de defensa a ultranza de la patria. 
					
					 Se cercioro en detalles del estado de cumplimiento de la mision de la unidad en la sala de estudio de operaciones. 
					
					 Aprecio reiteradamente que la unidad haya ampliado la vision tactica de los comandantes y los funcionarios del Estado Mayor mediante el establecimiento estricto del ambiente revolucionario de entrenamiento de pensar siempre en la situacion de la batalla y ponerlo en la practica, para que ellos defendieran como una fortaleza el mar de la patria con la decision de defender firmemente con las armas el partido, la revolucion y la patria socialista. 
					
					 En nuestro pais rodeado por el mar en tres lados son muy importantes la posicion y el papel de las fuerzas navales, dijo y presento las tareas programaticas que serviran de guia para fortalecerlas. 
					
					 Los militares deben vivir siempre suponiendo el campo de batalla aun en los momentos pacifistas y estar listos para vencer en el combate decisivo con los enemigos, asevero y apunto que un heroe y patriota en la guerra es un buen combatiente, pero en tiempo de paz, un soldado que hace bien los ejercicios. 
					
					 El Comandante Supremo tomo una fotografia junto con los oficiales y soldados de la comandancia. 
					
					 Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, el vicemariscal del EPC Ri Yong Ho, miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC, el general de ejercito del EPC Kim Jong Gak, miembro suplente del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, Kim Kyong Ok, miembro de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, y los generales de ejercito del EPC Kim Myong Guk, Kim Won Hong y Hyon Chol Hae.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Ri Jong San
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Ri Jong San
 Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, envio el dia 24 ante el feretro del difunto Ri Jong San, submariscal del EPC y diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Se aumentan visitantes al Museo de Historia Revolucionaria de Jonsung
articles.content:
Se aumentan visitantes al Museo de Historia Revolucionaria de Jonsung
 Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ATCC) -- En visperas del dia de victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y de las Fuerzas Populares del Interior de Corea, los funcionarios de ministerios e instituciones centrales, los trabajadores, los jovenes y ninos escolares visitan incesantemente el Museo de la Historia Revolucionaria de Jonsung.
					 En el nuevo siglo el numero de visitantes alcanza hasta ahora a mas de 2 millones 240 mil de mas de 13 mil entidades.
					
					 En el museo estan expuestos los datos y materiales historicos que muestran las imborrables hazanas del Presidente  Kim Il Sung quien con su autoctona idea militar y el destacado arte de mando militar condujo a la victoria la pasada Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria. 
					
					 Los visitantes sienten que gracias a tener al Presidente, el ejercito y el pueblo coreanos pudieron dar a los agresores una gran derrota militar, politica y moral en la sagrada guerra antiyanqui y ostentar a todo el mundo la dignidad del pais y la nacion.
					
					 Tras recorrer el museo, muchos compatriotas en ultramar y los extranjeros expresaron el infinito respeto al Presidente elogiandolo como comandante legendario nunca visto en la historia que registro una pagina brillante en la historia de la lucha antiimperialista y antiyanqui.

articles.title: Actividades por el 27 de julio en Corea
articles.content:
Actividades por el 27 de julio en Corea
 Pyongyang, 25 de julio (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 58o aniversario del triunfo en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria (1950-1953), tuvieron lugar este lunes en la Casa Central de Obreros la funcion del grupo de propaganda artistica del Comite Central de la Federacion General de los Sindicatos de Corea, y en el lugar de interes historico-revolucionario de Kumchon de la ciudad de Sunchon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur, el concierto de los trabajadores agricolas "Es eterno el 27 de julio de victoria gracias a contar con nuestro General".
					 Se presentaron en las escenas diversas piezas tales como el coro "!Viva el Generalisimo Kim Il Sung!", "27 de julio, dia de la victoria", el coro masculino "Cancion de la defensa de la Patria", la serie de canciones creadas en tiempo de guerra "Mi cancion en la trinchera" y el trio masculino y pangchang "Por la unica patria". 
					
					 Los ejecutantes alabaron altamente las hazanas del Presidente Kim Il Sung quien logro brillante triunfo en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria con la autoctona ideologia militar, la inteligencia y el arte de mando militar extraordinarios.
					
					 Ademas, describieron emocionantemente el mundo espiritual y el aspecto de la lucha heroica del ejercito y el pueblo coreanos, quienes unidos monoliticamente en torno al Presidente, lograron  la victoria en la pasada guerra coreana tras derrotar a los agresores. 
					
					 El mismo dia, se realizo en la capitalina Casa de Mujeres un encuentro de los heroes y las miembros de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea.
